senses.sense_definition: Relating to the region of the Earth near the equator where the climate is typically hot and humid.

examples.text: The <w>tropical</w> rainforest is home to thousands of unique species.
They planned a vacation to a <w>tropical</w> island to escape the winter cold.

senses.sense_definition: Extremely hot and humid, resembling the weather found in the tropics.

examples.text: We suffered through the <w>tropical</w> heat without any air conditioning.
The greenhouse maintained a <w>tropical</w> atmosphere for the exotic plants.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to the use of tropes or figures of speech; figurative rather than literal.

examples.text: The author used <w>tropical</w> language to describe the simple event in a grand manner.
Scholars analyzed the <w>tropical</w> meaning behind the ancient text.

senses.sense_definition: Relating to a specific area of mathematics known as tropical geometry.

examples.text: Researchers are applying <w>tropical</w> geometry to solve problems in algebra.
The lecture focused on <w>tropical</w> curves and their properties.

senses.sense_definition: A plant that is native to a tropical climate.

examples.text: The gardener keeps her delicate <w>tropicals</w> indoors during the winter months.
He has a large collection of <w>tropicals</w> that require high humidity to survive.
